Package com.trapdoor_escape.src.character

Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.trapdoor_escape.src.character.Character
com.trapdoor_escape.src.character.Player
public class Player extends Character
Player a subclass of Character. It is controlled by the user throughCharacterControls can interact with the ObjectItem to find and exit through the Trapdoor before the time runs out.
Since:
06 JUN 2022
Version:
0.0.1
Author:
CARLOS MIGUEL PINEDA

  • Field Details

    • moveCounter

      public static int moveCounter
      stores how many moves the user has done and resets 0 when it reaches to 30.

    • MOVE_LIMIT

      public static final int MOVE_LIMIT
      stores the number of moves before objects will be displaced again
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(GamePanel gamePanel)
      Constructor for new Player with default white suit and resets the moveCounter.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - - serves as the communication channel for other classes.
      See Also:
      • setCharacterDefault()
      • getPlayerImage()

  • Method Details

    • setCharacterDefault

      public void setCharacterDefault()
      Defines the initial position of the Player, which is in the center of the playing field. Let initial direction be an arbitrary direction. Let initial speed be the pixel for one tile(48 pixels), and initial color be the white suit.

    • getPlayerImage

      public void getPlayerImage()
      Defines the current color and direction of the Player. Color and direction are subject to change when encountering spirits and key arrow commands, respectively. Atleast two images are needed for each direction to create an animation of walking.

    • update

      public void update()
      Changes the abscissa and ordinate of the Player depending on the given direction. Before making a move, it detects if there will be a collision for the tile to move through the CollisionDetection. After moving, it increases the moveCounter until it reaches the MOVE_LIMIT, where it calls restart().
      See Also:
      • restart()

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Redraws the Player from its updated information from update(). We also call getPLayerImage() to consider instance when color has been changed.
      Parameters:
      g2 - - A Graphics2D that allows several methods.
      See Also:
      • getPlayerImage()

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Restarts the moveCounter of the Player and calls scramble() to change the ObjectItem positions.
